result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bo Allen Atter

records.addlTxt: Defendant's interrogatories and request for production of documents

3:36 PM 22CF57, 22TR69, and 22TR70 called together.  Defendant Bo Allen Atter in court.  Attorney Curtiss Norman Lein appeared by video for Bo Allen Atter.  Attorney Rebecca Adams not in court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Def has asked to have Curtiss Lein in place of Atty Rebecca Adams.  Court addresses parties, recaps the status of the case and offer for atty Lein, wants to understand why the late request for substitution.  Atty Lein argues in support of becoming counsel of record in this case.  Court will grant the substitution, will sign the order for substitution.  Court gives until next STC to file any motions.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Atty Lein to file a written demand for discovery.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea hearing on September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:40 AM Called 22CF57, 22TR69 and 22TR70 for STC.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bo Allen Atter in court.  Attorney Rebecca Adams appeared by video for Bo Allen Atter. Attny Adams update the court, resolution and wishes to set PLEAS.  State recites offer, G to OWI 2nd causing injury, PSI, both sides free to argue.  Court asks if def discussed this with attny, Def not sure, confused. 10:42am Off the record to have a breakout room between def and attny.  10:56 AM Back on the record, same appearances. Def talked with attny.  Attny updates the court, resolution reached and asks for a Plea.  Def understands.  PLEAH in person, will be an immediate report to jail.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:48 AM Cases 22CF57, 22TR69 and 22TR70 called together.  Defendant, Bo Allen Atter, appeared with Attorney Rebecca Adams.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: offer received, resolution not yet reached, update filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

03:08 PM Cases 22CF57, 22TR69, and 22TR70 called together.  Defendant, Bo Allen Atter, appeared with Attorney Rebecca Adams.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Bo Allen Atter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case 22CF57 on for Arraignment. Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

03:56 PM Cases 22CF57, 22TR69, and 22TR70 called together.  Defendant, Bo Allen Atter, appeared with Attorney Rebecca Adams.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Bo Allen Atter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Cases 22TR69 and 22TR70 on for status conferences.  Case 22CF57 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information divergent from the original complaint (amended complaint filed).  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 28, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

10:05 AM Cases 22CF57, 22TR69, and 22TR70 called together.  Defendant, Bo Allen Atter, appeared with Attorney Rebecca Adams.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  TR cases on for intake, def enters NG pleas to the allegations in the TR files.    Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  Def enters NG plea to misdemeanor count in CF file.  State requests signature bond with standard OWI conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

No driving without a valid driver's license, proper registration and insurance.  No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
